title: The high life
caption: In the Himalayas for International Mountain Day
desc: The summit of Ama Dablam rises up behind Tengboche Monastery, a Tibetan Buddhist site more than 12,000ft above sea level. Ama Dablam means mother's necklace: Its swooping shape is thought to resemble a mother cradling a child while a dangling glacier on its south-west face has been likened to the religious pendants many Sherpa women wear. The monastery is a stop on the Sacred Sites Trail Project, a self-guided trek through holy places in Nepal's Sagarmatha National Park.
